adverbs.description: epistemically (comparative more epistemically, superlative most epistemically)

entries.meaning: In a way that pertains to knowledge and cognition.
(usually, more specifically) In a way that pertains to metaknowledge and epistemology (awareness of the source, truth, and epistemologic grounding of knowledge).
examples: We can say that a message, M, is epistemically defective if either it is false, inappropriate, or connected to other beliefs in ways that are inapt, misleading, or unwarranted.
